title: J117
author: J117
content: Hello everyone,In my country there are no miners BTC, I would like to talk in real life (maybe lunch together) for discussion about the possibilities to create something in Holland. Is there miner btc in Amsterdam, hereI will be in Amsterdam soon

comments.author: LoyceMobile
comments.body: What do you pay for electricity? There's a reason it's not viable in the Netherlands: it's not profitable.

comments.author: Queentoshi
comments.body: Quote from: J117 on August 23, 2022, 04:23:46 PMIn my country there are no miners BTC,Or you should say that you have not come across any miner yet. Some people keep these things secret, and will never come out plain to just tell anyone that they mine bitcoin.Quote from: J117 on August 23, 2022, 04:23:46 PMIs there miner btc in Amsterdam, hereIf this thread stays long enough, most likely you can meet someone in Amsterdam.

comments.author: J117
comments.body: This is a post for meet expert miner in Europe. I don't know much miners and I would like meet they

comments.author: onlinehandelen
comments.body: I used to be a Dutch miner but not in Amsterdam atm. You can PM me to talk crypto mining-related stuff.

comments.author: Larson311
comments.body: Quote from: J117 on August 23, 2022, 07:28:10 PMThis is a post for meet expert miner in Europe. I don't know much miners and I would like meet they I'll be in Amsterdam for ADE next October and I'm mining BTC but my advice is to check out the Elec cost which I guess must be very exp in Holland now!

comments.author: PawGo
comments.body: Not BTC, but was there any serious ETH mining?I wonder if we may expect any bigger wave of used GPU cards in Benelux. Looking at 2dehands.nl there are some rigs for sale, but I think it did not start yet.Could be a good time coming to buy some hardware crap  Personally I look for 2x2080 to play a little with nvlink.
